title: Trigun - Multiple Bullets
description:
Trigun is back with a heavily armed posse of talented gunslingers. An anthology of tales, Multiple Bullets features the hard-to-find story Badlands Rumble by Trigun's creator Yasuhiro Nightow. Plus original stories from Boichi, Yusuke Takeyama, Satoshi Mizukami, Kennji Mitsuyoshi and Koichi Ishikawa's studio Ark Performance, Akira Sagami, humor cartoonist Yuga Takauchi and Masakazu Ishiguro.

[b]Contents:[/b]
[*][u]Trigun Badlands Rumble[/u] by [url=https://mangadex.org/search?artist=Nightow%20Yasuhiro]Nightow Yasuhiro[/url]
Vash is caught in a sticky situation with the evil Dodongo Bros. until Wolfwood saves him and they retreat. In the city, they meet with two men who want to hire Vash & Wolfwood to protect their city from those very same Dodongo Bros.

[*][u]Trigun: The Lost Plant[/u] by [url=https://mangadex.org/search?artist=Boichi]Boichi[/url]
A short one shot written and drawn by Boichi featuring Vash the Stampede set after the events of Trigun Maximum. (Included at the end of Sun-Ken Rock vol 12)

[*][u]Denizens of the Sand Planet[/u] (Suna no Wakusei no Tami) by [url=https://mangadex.org/search?artist=Mizukami%20Satoshi]Satoshi Mizukami[/url]

[*][u]Les Enfants[/u] by [url=https://mangadex.org/search?artist=Ark%20Performance]Ark Performance[/url]

[*][u]Eisei Mil Mer TV[/u] (Mil/Mer TV) by [url=https://mangadex.org/search?artist=Takauchi%20Yuuga]Yuga Takauchi[/url]

[*][u]Trigun: Rising[/u] by [url=https://mangadex.org/search?artist=Takeyama%20Yuusuke]Takeyama Yuusuke[/url]
A oneshot to celebrate the release of the Trigun movie. The story focuses on Rai The Blade, one of the Gung-Ho Guns, who is living in a small Plant town.

[*][u]Cutting is Fighting[/u] by [url=https://mangadex.org/search?artist=Sagami%20Akira]Akira Sagami[/url]

Also includes illustrations by [url=https://mangadex.org/search?artist=Ishiguro%20Masakazu]Masakazu Ishiguro[/url]
